gw.financials

Class Prorater

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.financials.Prorater

  • public abstract class Prorater
extends java.lang.Object
    Base interface for the Prorater, which is used to do date-based proration of all rating and financial data.

    • Method Detail

      • prorateFromStart

        protected abstract java.math.BigDecimal prorateFromStart(java.util.Date periodStart,
                                                         java.util.Date periodEnd,
                                                         java.util.Date prorateTo,
                                                         java.math.BigDecimal amount)
        Prorate an amount from periodStart to prorateTo, based on a full period running from periodStart to periodEnd. periodStart must be greater than periodEnd, in order to prevent a divide-by-zero.
        Parameters:
        periodStart - the beginning of the period
        periodEnd - the end of the period
        prorateTo - the end of the interval being prorated - [periodStart..prorateTo)
        amount - the amount which should be prorated
        Returns:
        the prorated amount

        Return the rounding level that this prorater is using
        Returns:
        The rounding level with which ths prorater was constructed

        public java.math.RoundingMode getRoundingMode()
        Return the rounding mode that this prorater is using.
        Returns:
        The rounding mode with which this prorater was constructed

      • financialDaysBetween

        public int financialDaysBetween(java.util.Date startDate,
                                java.util.Date endDate)
        Calculate the number of days between startDate and endDate for financial purposes. The default implementation uses the number of calendar days between the two dates, but if, for example, financial calculations should ignore leap years, then the number may be different if the date range includes a February 29.
        Parameters:
        startDate - The first date INCLUDED in the date range
        endDate - The first date BEYOND the date range.
        Returns:
        the number of days between the two dates.

      • findEndOfRatedTerm

        public java.util.Date findEndOfRatedTerm(java.util.Date startDate,
                                         int daysInTerm)
        Calculate the calendar end date of a rated term based on its start date and days in term. This function must accommodate (i.e. reverse) any alterations made by financialDaysBetween. For example, financialDaysBetween ignores February 29, the leap day must be added back as part of some calendar calculations, in order to maintain normal calendar behavior. (In this example, a six-month period starting on January 1 must have an expiration date of July 1, whether it is a leap year or not.)
        Parameters:
        startDate - The start date from which to calculate
        daysInTerm - The number of financial days in the term
        Returns:
        The calculated end date for the term

      • scaleAmount

        public java.math.BigDecimal scaleAmount(java.math.BigDecimal amount)
        Scale amount according to the appropriate rounding level and mode. This default implementation simply returns amount
        Parameters:
        amount - The value to be scaled
        Returns:
        the correctly scaled value

      • scaleAmount

        public MonetaryAmount scaleAmount(MonetaryAmount amount)
        Scale amount according to the appropriate rounding level and mode. This default implementation simply returns amount
        Parameters:
        amount - The value to be scaled
        Returns:
        the correctly scaled value

      • forRounding

        public static Prorater forRounding(int roundingLevel,
                                   java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode,
                                   ProrationMethod method)
        Get a Prorater with the specified rounding characteristics
        Parameters:
        roundingLevel - the rounding level (number of fractional digits)
        roundingMode - the rounding mode (a constant from BigDecimal)
        method - the proration method to use
        Returns:
        a Prorater set up to round in the specified manner

      • forFinancialDays

        public static Prorater forFinancialDays(ProrationMethod method)
        Get a Prorater with the specified proration method, primarily for date calculations Equivalent to calling getProraterForRounding(0, UNNECESSARY, method)
        Parameters:
        method - the proration method to use
        Returns:
        a Prorater constructed as described above

      • prorate

        public final java.math.BigDecimal prorate(java.util.Date periodStart,
                                          java.util.Date periodEnd,
                                          java.util.Date prorateStart,
                                          java.util.Date prorateEnd,
                                          java.math.BigDecimal amount)
        Prorate an amount for a date range [prorateStart, prorateEnd) which is a subPeriod of the full period [periodStart, periodEnd].
        Parameters:
        periodStart - the start of the full period
        periodEnd - the end of the full period
        prorateStart - the start of the partial period being prorated
        prorateEnd - the end of the partial period being prorated
        amount - the full amount to be prorated
        Returns:
        amount, prorated according to the fraction [prorateStart, prorateEnd) / [periodStart, periodEnd)

      • prorate

        public final MonetaryAmount prorate(java.util.Date periodStart,
                                    java.util.Date periodEnd,
                                    java.util.Date prorateStart,
                                    java.util.Date prorateEnd,
                                    MonetaryAmount amount)
        Prorate an amount for a date range [prorateStart, prorateEnd) which is a subPeriod of the full period [periodStart, periodEnd].
        Parameters:
        periodStart - the start of the full period
        periodEnd - the end of the full period
        prorateStart - the start of the partial period being prorated
        prorateEnd - the end of the partial period being prorated
        amount - the full amount to be prorated
        Returns:
        amount, prorated according to the fraction [prorateStart, prorateEnd) / [periodStart, periodEnd)
